item.title: I love the 'multi-cursor-increment' package
item.description: I truly like the multiple cursors in Atom. I remember the first I used such feature, it was on Sublime Text, it blew my mind. I now use it pretty much everyday, and I have noticed that this is now a common feature among editors/IDEs, for instance, R users can use it in RStudio. Many time I hoped that a version of the multiple cursor would exist where it would be possible to set a sequence of number, I even thought that I should do it. Well, I must admit that I have never looked up for the existence of such feature until recently and guess what… it already exists!! Check the multi-cursor-increment package out!
